head.title: Catherine Merino and Daniel N. Reisman Marry

hedline.hl1: Catherine Merino and Daniel N. Reisman Marry

block.p: Catherine Louise Merino, the daughter of Mrs. and Mrs. James Merino of Denton, Tex., and Daniel Noah Reisman, a son of Mr. and Mrs. Arnold Reisman of Raleigh, N.C., were married yesterday at the Downtown Club in Philadelphia. Judge Edward N. Cahn of the Federal District Court for Eastern Pennsylvania performed the ceremony.

Ms. Merino, who is 27 years old and will keep her name, graduated magna cum laude from New York University. Both she and her husband are 1989 graduates of the Yale Law School. Ms. Merino is a clerk for Judge Cahn. Her mother, Barbara Merino, is a professor of accounting at the University of North Texas. Her father retired as a professor of history at Murray (Ky.) State University.

Mr. Reisman, 30, graduated summa cum laude from the State University of New York in Albany. He is an associate at the Philadelphia law firm of Hangley Connolly Epstein Chicco Foxman & Ewing. His mother, Hilda Reisman, is a former public school teacher in New York City and Yorktown, N.Y. His father is a professor of electrical engineering at North Carolina State University and a vice president of the Microelectronics Center of North Carolina at Raleigh.
